str2: Happy, blessed, to be envied. A prolonged form of the poetical makar; supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To hate, detest, love less, esteem less. From a primary misos; to detest; by extension, to love less.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And, even, also, namely.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To rail off, separate, place apart. From apo and horizo; to set off by boundary, i.e. limit, exclude, appoint, etc.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To reproach, revile, upbraid. From oneidos; to defame, i.e. Rail at, chide, taunt.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Evil, bad, wicked, malicious, slothful.
Or heneken hen'-ek-en or heineken hi'-nek-en; of uncertain affinity; on account of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
